bill_title: Recognizing Ari and Annie van Tienhoven upon visiting the South Dakota State Capitol to celebrate their fiftieth wedding anniversary.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Recognizing Ari and Annie van Tienhoven upon visiting the South Dakota State Capitol to celebrate their fiftieth wedding anniversary. WHEREAS, Ari and Annie van Tienhoven of Ithaca, New York, were married on March 14, 1950, in Urbana, Illinois; and WHEREAS, it has been a goal of the van Tienhoven's to visit the capitols of all fifty states; and WHEREAS, on January 16, 2000, Ari and Annie van Tienhoven will be in Pierre to celebrate their fiftieth year of marriage by visiting their fiftieth state capitol: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Ari and Annie van Tienhoven be extended on behalf of the citizens of South Dakota a hearty welcome to our beautiful state capitol upon this event of visiting their fiftieth state capitol and be congratulated for their fifty years of marriage.

WHEREAS, Ari and Annie van Tienhoven of Ithaca, New York, were married on March 14, 1950, in Urbana, Illinois; and WHEREAS, it has been a goal of the van Tienhoven's to visit the capitols of all fifty states; and WHEREAS, on January 16, 2000, Ari and Annie van Tienhoven will be in Pierre to celebrate their fiftieth year of marriage by visiting their fiftieth state capitol: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Ari and Annie van Tienhoven be extended on behalf of the citizens of South Dakota a hearty welcome to our beautiful state capitol upon this event of visiting their fiftieth state capitol and be congratulated for their fifty years of marriage.
